text: I reckon this could be achieved via a browser extension
Ability to use `{% extends "Hubl_file" %}` in an email drag and drop template and also not have HubSpot add code to the template.

probably hard to implement.

I’d like the ability to know an individual field in a custom module’s dependents.

Here’s the scenario.

Client wants a significant change to a module. I want to just update the module and cleanly change one of the fields to a new field type. Unfortunately doing so would break old instances of the module.
I could clone it but that muddies up the add custom module window

Reviving an idea from <@U22PNRAJD> <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/HubSpot-Ideas/copy-paste-modules-between-templates/idi-p/11178?advanced=false&collapse_discussion=true&q=copy%20modules&search_type=thread>

Ability to copy n paste modules between templates, along with their css/inline-styles and other options set.
You can do that with this developer extension. If you want to do it now :slightly_smiling_face: <https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/hubx-by-neambo/dmgpiodabbkeicgkhpokecnlpjddjmah?hl=en>

yea, I know. I just would prefer it be built in. partly because I’m not sure how HubX is actually doing it( their code’s obfuscated).

basically I worry they’re relying on some things that could break down the road when HS makes a change and it could break a template
Heads up- you might encounter some performance issues running this extension in the design tools :disappointed:
any idea of the cause?(wondering if a HS change means I might have to update the <#CBBAW6Z3R|community-browser-extension> to accomodate)
